result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Angela T. Alloway was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On driver's license and all vehicles titled in her name commencing upon issuance of valid DL.
Attorney Joy to prepare Stip and Order for any jail credit (only revoked).

miscConds.notes: To be paid within the first year of probation.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA per week while on probation and provide proof of attendance to P&P agent.

timeConds.notes: Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.20 - Court has no objections to electronic surveillance but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff.
As deemed appropriate by P&P. To be completed within the first year of probation after release from incarceration.

Defendant Angela T. Alloway in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Angela T. Alloway in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:00 PM. Joy filed a motion asking for sentence credit for stated reasons, asking for one day credit so the defendant to be released today instead of tomorrow. State responds - no new information to make this a sentence modification. Court denies motion for stated reasons.
Motion hearing on May 23, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Motion hearing on June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Credit for Time Served
from attorney Joy to court regarding defendant - court approves request
#1 - certified driver's record; #2 - toxicology results' #3 - 3 pages of photos from scene

Defendant Angela T. Alloway in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:12 PM. State - resolved but not a joint recommendation. State - defendant would plead G to count #1 as alleged and DRI count #2 and dismiss without prejudice count #3. Joy agrees, State would be asking for probation with one year in jail and Joy will be asking for 8 months in jail. Court dismisses and reads in count #2 and dismisses without prejudice count #3. Alloway pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges plea, proceed to sentencing. Alloway acknowledges 5 prior OWI convictions. State offers exhibits #1 - certified driving record of defendant, #2 - toxicology report and #3 - series of photos. Court receive all three exhibits after no objections. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends an imposed and stayed sentence of 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES, stayed, place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail, AODA and follow thru, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, fine of $4500.00 - inclusive of costs - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation, 300 hours of community service, IID for 36 months, 36 month DL revocation, reimburse FOSO $35.00 for blood draw, no consumption of possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns. Joy provides court with information regarding defendant's treatment and statements from witnesses, makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 8 months in FC jail as a condition of probation along with the imposed and stayed sentence as mentioned by the State. Alloway makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - impose 4 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, stayed, place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.20 - electronic surveillance is left up to FOSO Sheriff - report today - Joy will submit Stip and Order for credit. fine of $4500.00 inclusive of costs - take bond posted - remainder due within the first year of probation, 3 years DL revocation, IID on DL and all vehicles titled in her name for 3 years commencing upon issuance of valid DL, AODA and follow thru, reimburse FOSO for $35.00 for blood draw - take bond posted first and remainder of bond on fine, no consumption of possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 300 hours of community service within the first year of probation after release from incarceration, attend at least one AA/NA each week during probation and provide proof of attendance to P&P, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Angela T. Alloway in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:12 am. No resolution for stated reasons. Set for JT. Frye has been explained by attorney Joy. Alloway wants trial date.  Jury trial scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angela T. Alloway in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:51 PM. State files Amended Complaint. Joy and Alloway have Amended Complaint and understands all charges and penalties. State - parties stipulate to 5 prior OWI convictions. State calls Sgt. Mark Raddatz. Raddatz sworn in at 2:52 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Joy at 3:01 PM. State objects - relevance - sustained (3:07 PM). Raddatz excused at 3:09 PM. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors Amended Complaint. Joy has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Angela T. Alloway in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:04 AM. Joy has complaint as does defendant, waives reading, requests PH and will waive time limits. Court sets for PH. Joy - asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections. Court - bond - amends bond to $1000 cash bond with same conditions, refund $1500.00 to poster.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
